title: With multiple instances, how to use shortcut to open new window.
content:
Thank you for your patience on this particular matter. Any solutions?

Short ver. of the problem: with a designated profile, I cannot launch a new window of an already running firefox using shortcut. Error msg "Firefox is already running, but is not responding. ...". I have to first active the firefox window and then use Ctrl+N, which is very annoying considering someone has to open/close many new windows a day.

Details: Here is my environment: in windows 10, say, I have three copies of firefox programs with their own profiles for different purposes. Something like this: D:\Firefox 1, this is the firefox program itself. D:\Firefox 2 D:\Firefox 3 D:\Profiles\1, this is the profile folder named as "1" D:\Profiles\2 D:\Profiles\3

I then use shortcut to launch each firefox, creating a shortcut then add options in the target line. Like this: D:\Firefox 1\firefox.exe -no-remote -profile D:\Profiles\1 D:\Firefox 2\firefox.exe -no-remote -profile D:\Profiles\2 D:\Firefox 3\firefox.exe -no-remote -profile D:\Profiles\3

I then use autohotkey to designate a particular hotkey to each firefox. Like this: Alt+1, launch firefox 1 Alt+2, launch firefox 2 Alt+3, launch firefox 3

The overall goal is to have complete separate operations.

The issue, I first use alt+1 or double click the shortcut with launch options to launch a firefox. Then, if I need to open another window of an already running firefox, which is minimized to the taskbar, I have to first activate the firefox window and then click ctrl+n. If I use the Alt+1 or double click the shortcut with launch options, an error msg pops saying, "Firefox is already running, but is not responding. ..." The ideal behavior is to use shortcut to launch a new window.

Thank you guys!
creator: moneykor

title: Is there a flag to limit max allocated memory per tab?
content:
I do not like how each tab uses hundreds of megabytes of memory for no reason. I have 32GB of RAM and still run out of memory from time to time due to Firefox and Chrome. It's just a waste of RAM. I want to control the maximum memory usage of each tab.

Is it possible?
creator: szx

title: Desktop shortcuts are white with small icon in Firefox 104.0.1
content: On my Windows 11 desktop PC, desktop Internet shortcuts created by dragging and dropping links are white squares with a small icon inside depicting the actual website logo. I don't know if this intended behavior or a bug.
creator: guatiao

title: Why does Mozilla Support keep showing up under "Connected Services" at accounts.firefox.com?
content: Just concerned what this is exactly because I noticed it once before and deleted it. Why does it need to be connected to my account? I tried Googling around to see if this was normal and I couldn't find anything.

title: Firefox not remembering tabs, passwords or signed in tabs
content: I did not update or fix firefox for these issues to start happening. after troubleshooting, I have reinstalled firefox and reset my settings, but firefox will still not remember my tabs when I close, will not suggest my accounts and passwords when I login, and will log out of my accounts when I close instead of staying open.
creator: laurencebutt1

title: dashlane auto fill
content: dashlane stopped auto filling fields on websites. Installed google chrome, set up as default, added dashlane extension and it works flawlessly. removed chrome, set laptop default back to firefox/duck-duck, etc. and reinstalled extension. still not working. i really hate to go back to google but i need a STABLE search platform.
